knowledge_chunks.topic: Introduction to the Beginner's Guide
knowledge_chunks.summary: The creator introduces the video as a comprehensive guide for new Elden Ring players. The guide aims to explain where to go, what to do, and how to approach the game's mechanics to reduce the initial overwhelming feeling and ensure players are well-equipped for their journey.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Part 1: Universal Tips and Core Mechanics for All Builds
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section explains the fundamental gameplay loop and provides several critical tips applicable to all new players. Key advice includes prioritizing the Vigor stat for health, upgrading weapons for damage over leveling stats early on, utilizing buffs, managing equip load to avoid 'fat rolling', and playing the in-game tutorial.

structured_data.core_gameplay_loop: Explore the open world to find dungeons and loot. Use a limited number of healing flasks to survive. Rest at Sites of Grace, which act as checkpoints but respawn most enemies. Collect runes from enemies to level up and find gear to improve your build. Defeat bosses for large amounts of runes and powerful loot.
structured_data.difficulty_philosophy: The game isn't as hard as it seems; it rewards learning and exploration. Dying is an expected part of the process, and with a good build, it becomes much less frequent.

fundamental_tips.description: Vigor, which determines max HP, is the most important stat for survivability. New players should level Vigor to 30 before any other stat, aim for 40 by the time they reach Rennala, and 60 by the end of the game. Leveling Vigor provides a much greater increase in effective health compared to wearing heavy armor.

In the early to mid-game, most of a player's damage comes from upgrading their weapons with Smithing Stones, not from leveling damage stats. Weapon upgrades increase both the weapon's base damage and its attribute scaling.
Buffs from spells, incantations, Ashes of War, and consumable items provide significant increases to damage and defense. Examples include Golden Vow and Flame, Grant Me Strength.
A 'Heavy Load' will result in a slow, ineffective 'fat roll' and slower stamina regeneration. Players should always stay in 'Medium Load' or 'Light Load' to maintain mobility.
The 'Cave of Knowledge' at the start of the game teaches essential mechanics and should not be skipped.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Part 2: Where to Go in Elden Ring - Early Game Progression
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section outlines the initial progression path for new players in Limgrave. It explains how to get the horse (Torrent) and the ability to level up, the importance of finding map fragments, following roads, and understanding the Guidance of Grace. It introduces the key concept of leaving a difficult area to explore elsewhere and returning later when stronger, using Margit and the Tree Sentinel as examples.

early_game_objectives.action: Rest at the grace to meet Melina, who grants these abilities after activating a few different graces.
Look for obelisk icons on the blank map. Go there to find Map Fragments which fill in the map's details, revealing points of interest.
Use roads as a guide to discover new and important locations like ruins, towers, and churches.
Recognize that the golden pointers from Sites of Grace lead to main story objectives. This is a suggestion, not a requirement.
If a boss (like Tree Sentinel or Margit) or an area is too difficult, it is a sign from the developers to explore other areas, level up, upgrade weapons, and find gear before trying again.

structured_data.recommended_progression_path: Explore Limgrave thoroughly, then head south to the Weeping Peninsula, which is a lower-level area. After clearing that, explore more of Limgrave or even venture carefully into Caelid for powerful items before returning to face Margit at Stormveil Castle.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Game Design: Understanding 'Gatekeeper' Bosses
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section explains that early-game bosses like Margit and the Tree Sentinel act as 'gatekeepers.' Their high difficulty is intentional, designed to teach players to explore the open world, find upgrades, and level up rather than trying to force their way down a linear path. If a boss feels too hard, the player is meant to leave and come back later when they are stronger.

data.purpose: To signal to the player that they are under-leveled or under-equipped for an area, encouraging them to explore the open world to find power-ups before returning.

boss_examples.intended_player_response: If the fight is too difficult, players should leave, explore other parts of Limgrave or the Weeping Peninsula, level up, find Smithing Stones to upgrade weapons, and then return.

boss_examples.location: Limgrave, near The First Step Site of Grace
boss_examples.intended_player_response: Players are encouraged to avoid him initially. By going around him to the Church of Elleh, they find an anvil and a merchant, teaching them about weapon upgrades. This reinforces the idea of coming back later when stronger.

data.key_takeaway: Elden Ring is designed for exploration. Hitting a wall at a major boss is a cue to explore side dungeons and other regions to get stronger, not to quit or repeatedly fight the same boss while underpowered.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Guide to Leveling Up and Attributes
knowledge_chunks.summary: A comprehensive guide to all character attributes in Elden Ring. It details the function of each stat (Vigor, Mind, Endurance, Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Faith, Arcane), offers leveling advice like prioritizing Vigor, and explains how damage stats and weapon scaling work. It also debunks the myth that rune farming leads to power, arguing that weapon upgrades and player skill are far more important.

attributes.name: Vigor
attributes.recommendation: The most important stat for survival. Get to 30 ASAP. Aim for 40 by the time you reach Rennala in Raya Lucaria, and 60 for the endgame.

attributes.name: Mind
attributes.recommendation: Mainly for spellcasters and players who use weapon skills or Spirit Ashes heavily. Melee builds may only need ~15. Expensive Spirit Ashes like Black Knife Tiche require high FP (132).

attributes.name: Endurance
attributes.recommendation: Primarily leveled for Equip Load to wear desired armor/weapons without 'fat rolling'. 15-20 Endurance is often sufficient. Stamina gain is a secondary benefit.

attributes.name: Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Faith, Arcane
attributes.recommendation: These are damage stats. After meeting minimum requirements for gear, level the stat your primary weapon scales best with (A or S scaling is best). Avoid spreading points too thinly.

key_concepts.rune_farming_fallacy: Farming runes for levels is a waste of time and does not make the game significantly easier. A level 232 player can still struggle with an early boss like Rennala if their weapon is not upgraded and they don't understand the boss mechanics.
key_concepts.true_power_sources: Player power comes primarily from Vigor, weapon upgrades (using Smithing Stones), and player skill (learning to dodge and attack effectively), not raw character level.
key_concepts.attack_speed_myth: Dexterity does NOT increase weapon attack speed. Attack speed is fixed for each weapon. It only slightly increases spell casting speed.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Combat Fundamentals and the Starting Class Myth
knowledge_chunks.summary: This segment explains that starting classes are largely irrelevant in the long run, as any class can find all starting equipment and level any stat. True mastery of Elden Ring comes from understanding its combat system: being deliberate with actions, learning enemy patterns to find attack windows, and avoiding panic-rolling or spamming attacks.

data.details: Your starting class is almost meaningless. It only sets your initial stats and equipment. All starting class equipment can be found in the world, and any class can level any stat to create any build. The choice only matters for the very early game or for min-maxing a specific PvP build.
data.example: An Astrologer (mage) can level Strength to use a great hammer, and a Hero (barbarian) can level Intelligence to cast sorceries.

principles.description: Avoid spamming attacks or panic-dodging. Every action has a commitment. You get punished for reckless actions.
Observe enemy attack patterns to learn when it is safe to dodge and when you have an opening to attack.
Enemies can 'read' your inputs (like healing or attacking) and react instantly. This is designed to punish predictable or poorly-timed actions.

knowledge_chunks.key_takeaway: Success in combat is not about having the flashiest moves, but about patiently learning the enemy and being disciplined and deliberate with your own actions.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Elden Ring Combat Fundamentals: Dodging, Punishing, and Defensive Options
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section details the core combat philosophy of Elden Ring, emphasizing deliberate action over spamming attacks. It explains the importance of baiting enemy moves, dodging, and attacking during their recovery animations, known as "punish windows." The guide also covers alternative defensive strategies like blocking, using hyper armor (poise) to trade hits, and utilizing Ashes of War like Endure or Lion's Claw.

concepts.name: Deliberate Combat
concepts.description: Elden Ring punishes players for spamming attacks or panic rolling. Success requires deliberate, thoughtful actions and understanding when to attack and when to defend.

concepts.name: The Dodge-and-Punish Loop
concepts.description: The fundamental combat rhythm involves baiting an enemy attack, dodging it, and then retaliating during the enemy's recovery animation. This opening is called a 'punish window'.

concepts.name: Learning Enemy Movesets
concepts.description: To effectively use punish windows, players must learn enemy attack patterns, including telegraphed moves and delayed attacks. A recommended practice method is to engage an enemy and only practice dodging their attacks until their timing is understood, before trying to counter-attack.

concepts.name: Healing Strategy
concepts.description: Punish windows are not just for attacking; they are also the safest opportunities to use a healing flask. Many enemies, like the Godskin Apostle, are programmed to 'input read' and punish healing attempts, so creating an opening is crucial.

concepts.name: Spacing and Alternative Defenses
concepts.description: Not every attack should be dodged. Sometimes it's better to sprint away or back off to create space, especially against area-of-effect or 'get off me' attacks. Jumping is also a key defensive tool against low, sweeping attacks and shockwaves, as it provides invincibility frames for the player's legs.

concepts.name: Boss 'Get Off Me' Moves
concepts.description: Many bosses have powerful, close-range attacks (e.g., Godrick's Stormcaller, Malenia's Waterfowl Dance) to punish overly aggressive players. The correct tactic is to land one or two hits during a punish window and then retreat to a safe distance.

concepts.name: Hyper Armor and Poise
concepts.description: Some player actions, like using two-handed colossal weapons or certain Ashes of War, grant hyper armor (poise). This allows the player to absorb a hit without being stunned, enabling them to 'trade' damage with an enemy. This is a viable alternative to dodging for certain builds.

mentioned_ashes_of_war.name: Lion's Claw
mentioned_ashes_of_war.description: An Ash of War that provides significant hyper armor, allowing the player to tank through attacks to land a powerful blow.

mentioned_ashes_of_war.name: Endure
mentioned_ashes_of_war.description: An Ash of War that grants massive, temporary poise (super armor) and a 45% damage reduction buff for 3 seconds. It can be used as a 'safety net' to tank through otherwise deadly attacks.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Overview of Dexterity Builds in Elden Ring
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section provides a general analysis of Dexterity builds' place in Elden Ring's meta. structured_data.playstyle: Spams the Storm Blade Ash of War as a primary attack. It functions as a ranged option and a high-damage, fast point-blank attack.
structured_data.ash_of_war_usage: The skill was buffed to make the blade and projectile hit simultaneously at close range, resulting in very high damage. Its animation is faster than a regular R1 attack with a Greatsword.
structured_data.location_note: The Storm Blade Ash of War is found early in Stormhill.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Bloodhound Build (All Game, LVL 100)
knowledge_chunks.summary: An all-game build focused on the Bloodhound's Fang curved greatsword, obtainable very early. The build revolves around its unique skill, 'Bloodhound's Finesse,' which offers high damage, mobility, and invincibility frames. The weapon can also be buffed.

structured_data.playstyle: Utilizes the Bloodhound's Finesse skill to dash through attacks with I-frames and deliver powerful hits. The weapon's innate bleed and buffability offer high damage potential.
structured_data.weapon_rationale: One of the best weapons in the game; obtainable early, has innate bleed, can be buffed, and has a fantastic unique skill.
structured_data.ash_of_war_usage: Provides an evasive dash followed by an upward slash. Can be followed up with a heavy attack for a quick forward dash and another slash.

synergies.description: Since the weapon is buffable, consumables or incantations can be used to add damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Lightning Dragoon Build (Endgame, LVL 150)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 150 endgame build centered on the Bolt of Gransax spear. It's a Dex/Faith build that plays as a defensive Dragoon, using a greatshield for block counters and the 'Ancient Lightning Spear' skill for devastating ranged attacks.

structured_data.playstyle: A defensive build that uses a greatshield and block counters, supplemented by the extremely long-range, high-damage weapon skill.
structured_data.weapon_rationale: A missable weapon with a powerful unique skill.
structured_data.ash_of_war_usage: Can be charged for extra damage and has exceptional range. Deals 100% Lightning damage, benefiting from specific talismans.
structured_data.talisman_synergy: Lightning Scorpion Charm, Shard of Alexander, and Godfrey Icon (for charged skill) all boost the skill's damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Golden Champion Build (Endgame, LVL 150)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 150 endgame build using the Ornamental Straight Sword, a paired weapon. The build alternates between a sword-and-board style for defense and using the 'Golden Tempering' skill to dual-wield the swords for an aggressive, multi-hit combo.

structured_data.playstyle: Versatile playstyle that switches between defensive (one-hand with shield) and offensive (two-handing to activate paired mode).
structured_data.weapon_rationale: A unique paired weapon that allows for dual-wielding move sets when two-handed.
structured_data.ash_of_war_usage: Buffs the swords with Holy damage and unlocks a special heavy attack combo (R2) that is a flurry of blows.
structured_data.talisman_synergy: Rotten Winged Sword Insignia and Millicent's Prosthesis significantly boost damage due to the rapid, successive hits of the weapon skill.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Black Knife Assassin Build (Endgame, LVL 150)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 150 endgame Dexterity/Faith build using dual Erdsteel Daggers. These daggers scale with both stats, and the build focuses on fast attacks buffed by incantations. The Black Knife is used as a utility weapon for its 'Blade of Death' skill.

structured_data.playstyle: Aggressive, fast-attacking dual dagger build that uses Faith-based buffs for high physical damage and the Black Knife skill for a powerful opening attack.
structured_data.weapon_rationale: Scales physical damage with both Dexterity and Faith, allowing buffs like Flame, Grant Me Strength to be effective.
structured_data.utility_weapon_usage: The 'Blade of Death' skill deals significant damage and temporarily reduces the target's max HP.
structured_data.spell_rationale: These incantations stack to provide significant physical damage buffs to the Erdsteel Daggers.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Blackflame Bushido Build (New Game Plus, LVL 150+)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A Dexterity/Faith hybrid build for NG+ that progresses the Supreme Samurai concept. It uses a Nagakiba and focuses on Black Flame incantations like Blackflame Blade and Black Flame Ritual, combined with aggressive Ashes of War like Phantom Slash for high damage output.

structured_data.playstyle: A hybrid caster/melee build that combines the rapid attacks of a katana with powerful Black Flame incantations.
structured_data.ash_of_war: Phantom Slash, Double Slash, or Sword Dance
structured_data.synergy: Uses the Godslayer's Seal to boost the power of Black Flame incantations.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Serpent Samurai Build (Endgame, LVL 150)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 150 build using the Serpentbone Blade katana to apply Deadly Poison. The strategy is to poison the enemy and then gain significant attack power buffs from items like the Mushroom Crown and Kindred of Rot's Exaltation.

structured_data.playstyle: Focuses on applying Deadly Poison to enemies and then capitalizing on the poison status with damage-boosting gear.
structured_data.weapon_rationale: Inflicts Deadly Poison, which ticks faster than regular poison.
structured_data.charged_attack_usage: The unique charged R2 hits twice, making it excellent for triggering talismans that rely on successive hits.
structured_data.armor1_rationale: Increases attack power when poison is triggered in the vicinity.
structured_data.talisman1_rationale: Increases attack power when poison is triggered in the vicinity.
structured_data.talisman_synergy: Winged Sword Insignia and Millicent's Prosthesis are also effective due to the two-hit charged R2.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Waterfowl Warrior Build (New Game Plus, LVL 150+)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A NG+ build for level 150 and beyond, centered on the Hand of Malenia katana and its unique skill, Waterfowl Dance. The build focuses on maximizing physical damage through successive attack buffs and managing the high stamina cost and long animation of the skill.

structured_data.playstyle: Relies on the Waterfowl Dance skill for massive AoE and single-target damage, while stacking attack power buffs from talismans.
structured_data.weapon_rationale: Obtained after defeating Malenia, a very late-game boss.
structured_data.ash_of_war_usage: A multi-hit flurry that deals incredible damage but has a long animation, requiring high poise to execute without interruption.
structured_data.talisman_synergy: Rotten Winged Sword Insignia, Millicent's Prosthesis, Shard of Alexander.
structured_data.stat_focus: High Dexterity, Vigor, Endurance (for stamina and equip load/poise), and Mind.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Soul Samurai Build (New Game Plus, LVL 150+)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A high-level NG+ build that is an evolution of the Magus build, functioning as a true Dex/Int spellblade. It uses a Keen Nagakiba buffed with Scholar's Armament for strong melee, and has high Intelligence to effectively cast powerful sorceries.

structured_data.playstyle: A pure Dexterity/Intelligence hybrid that excels in both melee combat and sorcery casting.
structured_data.weapon_buff_rationale: Adds significant magic damage that scales with the high Intelligence stat.
structured_data.stat_focus: High Dexterity and high Intelligence, requiring a high overall character level to be effective.
structured_data.spell_usage: Can effectively use a wide range of powerful sorceries due to high Intelligence.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Scarlet Spear Build (New Game Plus, LVL 150+)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A NG+ build using dual Rotten Crystal Spears to rapidly apply the Scarlet Rot status effect. The playstyle focuses on aggressive L1 attacks and leverages talismans that boost damage when a status effect is triggered nearby.

structured_data.playstyle: Aggressively applies Scarlet Rot using the fast dual-spear moveset, then gains increased attack power to finish off enemies.
structured_data.weapon_rationale: These spears have innate Scarlet Rot buildup and can be obtained late in the game.
structured_data.talisman_rationale: Both items provide a significant damage buff when Scarlet Rot is applied to a nearby enemy.
structured_data.talisman_synergy: Spear Talisman (boosts counter-attacks), Rotten Winged Sword Insignia, Millicent's Prosthesis (boost successive attack damage).

knowledge_chunks.topic: Vampiric Knight Build (New Game Plus, LVL 150+)
knowledge_chunks.summary: A tanky NG+ build focused on health regeneration. It uses the Butcher Knife, which restores HP on hit, combined with the 'Wild Strikes' Ash of War for rapid attacks. This creates a highly sustainable, vampiric playstyle.

structured_data.playstyle: A highly sustainable, tanky build that constantly regenerates health through weapon passives and rapid attacks from its weapon skill.
structured_data.weapon1_rationale: Restores 1% of max HP per enemy hit.
structured_data.weapon2_rationale: Alternative weapon that has the same HP-on-hit effect and also has innate bleed buildup.
structured_data.ash_of_war_usage: Allows for continuous, rapid swings that constantly trigger the weapon's health recovery passive.
structured_data.synergy: Combined with other health regeneration items like Taker's Cameo or health-over-time incantations, this build becomes extremely hard to kill.

video_info.title: Elden Ring: 15 BEST Intelligence Builds For Base Game & Shadow of the Erdtree

knowledge_chunks.topic: Introduction to Top 15 Intelligence Builds
knowledge_chunks.summary: This video presents a curated list of the top 15 Intelligence-based builds for Elden Ring, covering both the base game and the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC. The guide will explore various playstyles, including pure spellcasters and melee-magic hybrids, categorized by recommended levels (50, 100, 150+) to suit different stages of the game.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 50 Build: Moonveil Samurai
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section details a Level 50 mid-game hybrid build centered on the Moonveil katana. The build focuses on using the 'Transient Moonlight' Ash of War for its high magic damage and exceptional ability to break enemy stances, making it a powerful option once the stat requirements are met.

data.playstyle: A melee-magic hybrid that uses the Transient Moonlight skill for powerful ranged magic waves and high poise damage. The build focuses on damage output from the wave itself, which scales with Intelligence.
synergies: Assassin's Cerulean Dagger (for FP recovery on critical hits)
data.stance_damage_info: The magic projectile from the skill deals 12.5 poise damage. A direct hit from the katana adds an additional 15 (light attack) or 17.5 (heavy attack) poise damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: All-Game Build: Spellsword
knowledge_chunks.summary: This build is viable throughout the entire game, starting around level 50. It pairs a Greatsword, like the Claymore, with the 'Glintblade Phalanx' Ash of War. This combination is designed to inflict massive stance damage, capable of staggering most bosses in just two well-timed combos.

data.playstyle: Focuses on breaking enemy posture by combining the stance damage from Glintblade Phalanx's projectiles with a follow-up greatsword attack.
data.stance_damage_info: A full combo of Glintblade Phalanx projectiles and a greatsword follow-up attack deals exactly 42 stance damage, enough to break an 80-stance boss in two hits.

knowledge_chunks.topic: All-Game Build: Carian Cleaver
knowledge_chunks.summary: This details a high-damage, all-game build starting at level 50, using the Iron Cleaver with a Magic infusion. The core of the build is its unique running charged heavy attack (R2), which, when combined with various damage-buffing skills and talismans, can deliver devastating one-shot or two-shot blows.

equipment.usage: Use 'Contagious Fury' skill for a 20% damage buff.

data.playstyle: Stack damage buffs from Royal Knight's Resolve and Contagious Fury, then use the Iron Cleaver's unique forward-charging heavy attack for massive damage.
synergies: Axe Talisman
Spiked Cracked Tear
Ritual Sword Talisman
Magic Scorpion Charm

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 100 Build: Crystal Mage
knowledge_chunks.summary: A pure spellcaster build for level 100 focusing on Crystalian Sorceries. By using the Crystal Staff, which boosts the damage of these specific spells by 10%, this build turns sorceries like Crystal Torrent and Shattering Crystal into devastating attacks for late-game content.

data.playstyle: A pure mage build that maximizes the damage of Crystalian sorceries. Crystal Torrent is used to melt large, slow bosses, while Shattering Crystal provides an effective shotgun-style AoE for groups or mobile targets.
data.notes: At this level range (around 60 INT), the Crystal Staff's 10% damage bonus to Crystalian sorceries makes it outperform the Carian Regal Scepter for this specific spell school.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 100 Build: Darkmoon Spellblade
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 100 hybrid build using the Dark Moon Greatsword. The core strategy is to break enemy posture from a safe distance by combining the sword's unique magic projectile, buffed by its 'Moonlight Greatsword' skill, with the Greatblade Phalanx spell for consistent stance damage.

data.playstyle: Buff the sword, then use its charged heavy attacks to fire powerful frost projectiles. This is combined with Greatblade Phalanx to rapidly build stance damage and inflict frostbite.
data.stance_damage_info: The charged projectile from Moonlight Greatsword deals 24 stance damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 100 Build: Frost Knight
knowledge_chunks.summary: A versatile and very effective Level 100 build combining the Clayman's Harpoon with a shield. The spear is Cold-infused and uses the Ice Spear Ash of War, creating a powerful playstyle that mixes safe, defensive block-and-poke combat with a strong ranged attack that applies frostbite and high stance damage.

data.playstyle: A tanky hybrid that can block and attack simultaneously with the spear. The Ice Spear skill provides a potent ranged option for damage, stance breaking, and applying frostbite.
data.stance_damage_info: The Ice Spear skill deals 25 stance damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 100 Build: Moonveil Shinobi
knowledge_chunks.summary: This is an evolved version of the Moonveil Samurai for level 100, focusing on a dual-wield setup. It pairs the Moonveil with a Cold-infused Uchigatana in the off-hand, allowing the player to rapidly apply both bleed and frostbite status effects while retaining the potent Transient Moonlight skill.

data.playstyle: An aggressive dual-wield build that stacks status effects quickly. The player can use the fast dual-wield moveset for constant pressure or switch to two-handing the Moonveil to access its 'Transient Moonlight' skill.
data.synergies: Combining the Frostbite and Bleed status effects provides a powerful damage combination.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 150 Build: Meteor Mage
knowledge_chunks.summary: An endgame, level 150 pure spellcaster build themed around Gravity sorceries. This build dual-wields staves, holding the Meteorite Staff in the off-hand for its passive 30% damage boost to Gravity spells while casting with the Carian Regal Scepter for its superior sorcery scaling at high Intelligence.

off_hand_tool.usage: Held in off-hand for a passive 30% damage boost to Gravity Sorceries.

data.playstyle: Theme-focused sorcerer using a variety of Gravity spells that deal a mix of magic and physical damage, making it effective against enemies with high magic resistance.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 150 Build: Nebula Knight
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 150 endgame build featuring the Wing of Astel curved sword paired with a shield. The build's core is the 'Nebula' Ash of War, which creates a delayed AoE explosion of stars, ideal for damaging large bosses or groups of enemies in confined spaces, while maintaining a defensive block-and-counter melee style.

data.playstyle: A mix of standard melee with a shield and potent AoE magic. The Nebula skill is spammed against large or slow targets for continuous damage and stagger.
data.notes: The Wing of Astel deals 20% bonus damage to Gravity-type enemies. Each explosion from the Nebula skill deals 13 stance damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 150 Build: Royal Frost Knight
knowledge_chunks.summary: This is an advanced, level 150 version of the Frost Knight build, incorporating the Royal Greatsword. The build offers maximum flexibility, switching between the safe spear-and-shield combat of the Clayman's Harpoon and the immense AoE power of the Royal Greatsword's 'Wolf's Assault' skill.

data.playstyle: Swaps between two weapon setups: a defensive spear/shield combo for poking and ranged frost attacks, and a high-damage colossal sword for powerful AoE clearing and burst damage.
data.notes: Wolf's Assault deals 23 stance damage and applies 160 frost buildup via its weapon strike and explosion.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Level 150 Build: Moonlight Crusader
knowledge_chunks.summary: A level 150 build that fully realizes the potential of the Dark Moon Greatsword. It combines the sword's powerful ranged attacks with synergistic spells like Ranni's Dark Moon to debuff enemy magic resistance, resulting in a devastatingly powerful and versatile magic knight.

data.playstyle: Begins encounters by applying frostbite and a magic defense debuff with Ranni's Dark Moon, then follows up with the empowered projectiles of the Dark Moon Greatsword for massive damage.
data.notes: Ranni's Dark Moon has a unique property where it can dispel any spells it touches.

knowledge_chunks.topic: NG+ Build: Spell Thief
knowledge_chunks.summary: A powerful level 150+ build for New Game Plus, focusing on the Glintstone Kris dagger and its Ash of War, Glintstone Dart. This build excels at safely eliminating enemies from a distance by repeatedly using the weapon skill's chargeable, piercing magic projectile, trivializing many encounters.

data.playstyle: A safe and highly efficient ranged playstyle that relies on spamming the Glintstone Dart skill. The projectile pierces through multiple enemies and can be charged for increased damage.
data.notes: The projectile only scales with Intelligence, while the follow-up thrust deals high stance damage (30) but scales differently.

knowledge_chunks.topic: DLC Build: Gravity Sorcerer
knowledge_chunks.summary: This is a Shadow of the Erdtree build that enhances the Meteor Mage concept by incorporating new DLC gravity spells. It adds Gravitational Missile for crowd control and damage, and Blades of Stone for targeted physical damage, increasing the build's versatility against all enemy types.

data.playstyle: An upgraded pure sorcerer. Gravitational Missile pulls enemies together before exploding, and Blades of Stone provides a physical damage option for magic-resistant foes.
data.stance_damage_info: Charging Blades of Stone creates 2 additional eruptions, each dealing 8 stance damage for a total of 24.

knowledge_chunks.topic: DLC Build: Carian Knight
knowledge_chunks.summary: A hybrid DLC build utilizing the new Carian Sorcery Sword, which can cast sorceries with its heavy attacks. This unique weapon enables a true spellsword playstyle, seamlessly blending melee combat, blocking, guard counters, and spellcasting without needing to swap to a staff.

data.key_feature: Can cast equipped sorceries using its heavy attack (R2).
data.playstyle: A fluid spellsword that can block, guard counter, and cast spells without weapon swapping, offering a highly versatile moveset.
data.notes: Rellana's Twin Moons was buffed in patch 1.14 to have hyper armor, making it more viable in close quarters.

knowledge_chunks.topic: DLC Build: Moonveil Resurrected
knowledge_chunks.summary: An updated Moonveil build for the DLC that maximizes the weapon's skill, Transient Moonlight, by using the new Rellana's Cameo talisman. A recent patch buffed this talisman to provide a massive damage increase after a short delay, perfectly syncing with the skill's wind-up to produce incredible burst damage.

data.playstyle: Focuses on landing devastating Transient Moonlight attacks by leveraging the damage buff from Rellana's Cameo.
data.notes: Patch 1.14 reduced the delay on Rellana's Cameo from 1.5s to 1s and increased its damage bonus from 15% to 45%. When combined with Shard of Alexander, this results in a 67% damage increase to the weapon skill.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Step 1: Starting White Mask Varr's Questline
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk explains the first step to unlock the rune farm. The player must find the NPC White Mask Varr at 'The First Step' Site of Grace in Limgrave and exhaust his dialogue. The video also notes an alternative late-game method for players who may have already killed Varr, which involves a portal in the Consecrated Snowfield.

structured_data.start_location: The First Step Site of Grace, Limgrave
structured_data.objective: Exhaust all dialogue with White Mask Varr. He will instruct you to defeat Godrick the Grafted to continue.
structured_data.notes: If Varr has been killed, an alternate path to the farming area exists via a portal in the Consecrated Snowfield, but this is a very late-game area.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Step 2: How to Defeat Margit, the Fell Omen
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section details the strategy for defeating Margit, the Fell Omen, a required boss. It recommends summoning the NPC Sorcerer Rogier and using the Lone Wolf Ashes to overwhelm the boss, which makes it easier to stagger him with power attacks or the Uchigatana's special skill for critical hits.

structured_data.strategy: Summon Sorcerer Rogier and the Lone Wolf Ashes to distract and overwhelm Margit. Use power attacks or the Uchigatana's special skill to build stagger, then perform a critical hit.
structured_data.notes: The summons make the fight significantly easier by drawing the boss's aggression.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Step 3: Navigating Stormveil Castle to Reach Godrick
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk provides a walkthrough of Stormveil Castle, starting after the Margit fight and ending at Godrick's boss arena. It details a side path that bypasses the main gate, shows the location of the Rusty Key, and guides the player through various rooms and rooftops to reach the 'Liftside Chamber' and then the 'Secluded Cell' Sites of Grace.

structured_data.objective: Travel from the 'Castleward Tunnel' Site of Grace to the 'Secluded Cell' Site of Grace before Godrick.

points_of_interest.name: Side path around main gate
points_of_interest.description: After entering Stormveil, look for a hole in the wall on the left to take an easier route around the main gate.

points_of_interest.name: Rusty Key
points_of_interest.description: Found in a dark room guarded by a Banished Knight. It's required to unlock a door to proceed.

points_of_interest.name: Mimic's Veil
points_of_interest.description: Found in a chest in a large dining hall-like room.

points_of_interest.name: Liftside Chamber Site of Grace
points_of_interest.description: A key checkpoint found after navigating the castle rooftops and interior rooms.

structured_data.path_description: From Margit, enter Stormveil and take the side path. Go up the exterior cliffs, find the Rusty Key, unlock the door, navigate the rooftops, find the Liftside Chamber Site of Grace, and proceed through the courtyard with many enemies to the Secluded Cell Site of Grace.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Step 4: How to Defeat Godrick the Grafted
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section outlines the strategy for the Godrick the Grafted boss fight. The guide recommends summoning the NPC Nepheli Loux (her summon sign is near the boss door) and using Spirit Ashes to assist in the fight. Defeating him rewards Godrick's Great Rune, which is essential for continuing Varr's questline.

structured_data.strategy: Summon Nepheli Loux and Spirit Ashes to distract and damage the boss, allowing for easier attacks.
structured_data.notes: Defeating Godrick is mandatory to progress White Mask Varr's quest.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Step 5: Completing White Mask Varr's Questline
knowledge_chunks.summary: After defeating Godrick, return to Roundtable Hold and speak to the Two Fingers. Next, find White Mask Varr at Rose Church in Liurnia of the Lakes. Tell him the Two Fingers 'didn't seem right' to get Festering Bloody Fingers. The video explains both online (invade 3 times) and offline (defeat Magnus the Beast Claw in Altus Plateau) methods to progress. Finally, soak the Lord of Blood's Favor item in a dead Finger Maiden's blood at the Church of Inhibition and return to Varr to get the Pureblood Knight's Medal, which teleports you to the farming area.

pre_requisites: Spoken to the Two Fingers in Roundtable Hold
structured_data.objective: Meet Varr at Rose Church in Liurnia. Select 'They didn't seem right' dialogue. Complete the task he gives you (either online invasions or offline NPC fight). Receive the Lord of Blood's Favor, soak it in blood at the Church of Inhibition, and return to Varr for the final reward.
structured_data.objective_online: Use the Festering Bloody Finger to invade other players' worlds three times. You do not need to win.
structured_data.objective_offline: Travel to Writheblood Ruins in Altus Plateau. Find the red invasion sign and defeat the NPC invader 'Magnus the Beast Claw'.
structured_data.final_step: Receive the 'Lord of Blood's Favor' from Varr. Go to the Church of Inhibition in Liurnia, interact with the dead Finger Maiden to soak the cloth in blood. Return to Varr to be 'anointed' and receive the Pureblood Knight's Medal.
structured_data.reward_use: Using this item from your inventory teleports you to Mohgwyn Palace.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Step 6: Performing the Mohgwyn Palace Rune Farm
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk explains the actual rune farming method. Upon arriving at Mohgwyn Palace via the medal, run up the stairs to find the 'Palace Approach Ledge-Road' Site of Grace. From this grace point, look across the chasm and shoot the giant bird with a bow. The bird will run off the cliff, rewarding the player with over 11,000 runes. Simply rest at the grace to reset and repeat.

structured_data.method: From the Site of Grace, aim with a bow across the chasm at the large bird walking on a lower ledge. Shooting it will cause it to run off the cliff. Rest at the grace to make it respawn and repeat the process.
structured_data.efficiency: Extremely fast and repeatable, yielding millions of runes per hour when optimized.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Optional Step 7: Obtaining the Golden Scarab Talisman
knowledge_chunks.summary: This optional step details how to acquire the Golden Scarab talisman to increase rune acquisition by 20%. The talisman is a reward for defeating the Cleanrot Knight dual bosses located at the end of the Abandoned Cave in Caelid, which is filled with scarlet rot.

structured_data.effect: Increases runes acquired from defeated enemies by 20%.
structured_data.path_description: The cave entrance is across a canyon of tree roots. The cave itself requires navigating through scarlet rot.
structured_data.usage_scene: Equip this talisman before performing the bird farm to maximize rune gain.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Bonus Step 8: Crafting the Gold-Pickled Fowl Foot
knowledge_chunks.summary: This bonus step explains how to craft the Gold-Pickled Fowl Foot, a consumable that boosts rune acquisition by 30% for 3 minutes. The recipe (Missionary's Cookbook [2]) is sold by Patches. The video shows where to farm the necessary ingredients: Four-Toed Fowl Foot and Gold Fireflies.

how_to_craft.recipe_location: Sold by Patches in Murkwater Cave.

ingredients.location: Farmed from Guillemots (birds) on the coast west of The First Step Site of Grace.

knowledge_chunks.topic: How to get the Dectus Medallion (Right)
knowledge_chunks.summary: This chunk details the path to acquire the right half of the Dectus Medallion, which is necessary to activate the Grand Lift of Dectus. The player must travel from the Gatefront Ruins in Limgrave to a hidden portal behind the Third Church of Marika. This portal teleports the player to Caelid, where they must ride to Fort Faroth, climb a ladder, and retrieve the medallion from a chest.

path_summary.description: Start at the Gatefront Ruins Site of Grace in Limgrave.
Travel east, across the bridge, and then north to the Third Church of Marika.
Go behind the church, through some bushes, to find a hidden teleporter.
Use the teleporter to travel to Caelid (Bestial Sanctum).
Ride south, across the large bridge (ignore the dragon, Flying Dragon Greyll), and head towards the Minor Erdtree.
Use the Spiritspring (updraft) behind the Minor Erdtree to get onto the cliffs.
Ride to Fort Faroth in the distance and rest at the Site of Grace outside.
Enter the fort, go to the left, and climb the ladder to the roof.
The Dectus Medallion (Right) is in a chest on the roof.

knowledge_chunks.topic: How to get the Dectus Medallion (Left) & Bloody Slash Ash of War
knowledge_chunks.summary: This segment explains how to find the left half of the Dectus Medallion. Starting from the Third Church of Marika, the player travels south through the Mistwood to Fort Haight. The medallion is in a chest at the top of a tower inside the fort. Additionally, defeating the knight at the top of the stairs in Fort Haight awards the Bloody Slash Ash of War.

path_summary.description: Fast travel to the Third Church of Marika Site of Grace.
Follow the road south through the Mistwood until you reach Fort Haight.
Enter the fort, proceed up the wooden stairs to the battlements.
Climb the ladder inside the tower to find a chest containing the medallion.

optional_item.location: Dropped by the knight at the top of the stairs in Fort Haight.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Activating the Grand Lift & Invading for White Mask Varr's Quest
knowledge_chunks.summary: With both medallion halves, activate the Grand Lift of Dectus to reach the Altus Plateau. From the lift, travel north along the path to find a map fragment. Continue following the path until you reach a broken bridge with a portal. This portal takes you across the gap. From there, head south to the Writheblood Ruins. In the ruins, use the red summon sign to invade the NPC Magnus the Beast Claw. This must be done three times to advance White Mask Varr's quest.

structured_data.objective: Invade other players three times using the Festering Bloody Finger. Invading the NPC Magnus the Beast Claw at Writheblood Ruins counts for this.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Godskin Duo Boss Fight Strategy Using Sleep Pots
knowledge_chunks.summary: This guide details an effective and easy strategy to defeat the Godskin Duo by utilizing Sleep Pots. The core tactic is to incapacitate one boss with a Sleep Pot, deal maximum damage to them, and repeat the process, which staggers their respawns and turns the 2v2 fight into a series of manageable 1v1 encounters.

recommended_items.usage: Use to apply the sleep status effect, incapacitating one boss at a time.

fight_strategy.overall_plan: The strategy is to use Sleep Pots to fight each boss one-on-one. By killing one while the other is asleep, their shared health pool is damaged and their individual respawns are staggered, preventing the player from being overwhelmed.
fight_strategy.target_priority: It's recommended to focus on the Godskin Noble (the larger boss) first, as he is a bigger and easier target to hit with the initial Sleep Pot.
fight_strategy.sleep_application: The Godskin Apostle (the slender boss) will dodge projectiles if not in an attack animation. To reliably put him to sleep, dodge into one of his attacks to get close and immediately throw the Sleep Pot before he can recover.
fight_strategy.damage_maximization: Once a boss is asleep, do NOT go for an immediate critical hit (riposte). Instead, attack the sleeping boss from behind with regular attacks. These attacks will eventually break their poise and stun them, at which point you can perform a critical hit for maximum damage.
fight_strategy.respawn_management: Killing the bosses one at a time staggers their respawn timers. This is crucial as it ensures you are only ever fighting one active boss. Being conservative with Sleep Pots early on guarantees you will have enough for the entire fight as they respawn.

key_mechanics_to_counter.counter: Dodge through the attack. The timing is slightly later than you might instinctively think.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Storm Assault is primarily a PvP skill used for stunlocking. In a PvE context, it's largely ineffective. knowledge_chunks.summary: Poison Moth Flight is a DLC Ash of War that deals a flat 5% health damage to an already poisoned enemy. The concept is weak because it requires a poison setup for a small damage burst. It is completely outclassed by the DLC weapon 'Poison-Flower Blooms Twice', which has a similar skill that is better in every way (more damage, better lunge, applies Scarlet Rot).

knowledge_chunks.topic: #94 Ash of War: Golden Parry (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Golden Parry was once the best parry skill but was nerfed. It now has the same number of parry frames as a medium shield, which is a significant downgrade. knowledge_chunks.topic: #93 Ash of War: Vow of the Indomitable (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Vow of the Indomitable is a shield skill that provides a brief moment of complete invincibility. It's a very niche tool, primarily useful for dodging specific, hard-to-avoid attacks like lingering AoEs (e.g., Rykard, Placidusax). Its long recovery frames prevent spamming, and its utility is largely outclassed by the Raptor of the Mists skill.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #92 Ash of War: Stamp (Sweep) (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Stamp (Sweep) is an Ash of War where the user stomps to gain hyper armor, followed by a wide horizontal sweep. It is considered one of the least valuable 'Stamp' variations due to its long animation and mediocre stance damage. It is directly outclassed by Stamp (Upward Cut), which is faster and has the added utility of launching enemies into the air.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #91 Ash of War: Mighty Shot (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Mighty Shot is a sniping skill for small and medium bows, making it a viable option for Dexterity builds that don't meet the Strength requirements for Greatbows. While it serves its purpose, it is ultimately outclassed in the sniping role by Greatbows and in the general bow utility role by Rain of Arrows.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #90 Ash of War: Earthshaker (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Earthshaker is a Strength-based AoE skill with a similar animation to Golden Land and Waves of Darkness, but is considered less interesting. It's a short-range physical AoE with a long animation and less hyper armor than comparable skills. It's viewed as being outclassed by more effective options like Ground Slam or the unique skill Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #89 Ash of War: Through and Through (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Through and Through is a sniping Ash of War for Greatbows that allows arrows to pierce through enemies, making it useful for collateral damage. It can even hit large bosses multiple times with certain arrows. However, it is outclassed by the new DLC Ash of War, Igon's Drake Hunt, which offers higher damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #88 Ash of War: Gravitas (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Gravitas is a short-range magic AoE attack that pulls enemies inward. It's considered weak due to its low damage, poor stance damage, and lack of hyper armor. The pull-in effect is often a detriment rather than a benefit. It is completely outclassed by the unique version of the skill on the Alabaster Lord's Sword, which has significantly better range and damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #87 Ash of War: Lifesteal Fist (C-Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Lifesteal Fist is a highly niche grab attack that only works on a select list of smaller humanoid enemies, such as knights and soldiers. Against these specific targets, it can be used to cheese them by infinitely grabbing them, dealing damage, and healing the player. Its low ranking comes from the fact that it is completely ineffective against the vast majority of enemies in the game.

knowledge_chunks.summary: Barrage is a bow-exclusive skill that enables rapid firing of arrows. knowledge_chunks.summary: Rolling Sparks is an Ash of War for Perfume Bottles that launches a rolling projectile which explodes multiple times. knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Golden Land (#62, B Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Golden Land is a Holy-based skill for large weapons, creating a short-range AoE followed by tracking projectiles. It is a versatile two-in-one skill scaling with Faith. Its main weakness is the Holy damage type, which is heavily resisted by many late-game bosses, making it less effective than dedicated spells for Faith builds.

item.description: User slams their weapon down, creating a Holy AoE, then launches multiple tracking Holy projectiles.
pros: Versatile, combining an AoE and a ranged attack in one skill.
Projectiles have good tracking.
Synergizes with the Great Stars weapon for health regeneration.
cons: Deals Holy damage, which is resisted by many late-game bosses.
Faith builds typically have access to better dedicated AoE or sniping spells (e.g., Frenzied Burst), making it somewhat redundant.
usage_scene: A flexible option for Faith builds to save memory slots.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Glintstone Pebble (#61, B Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Glintstone Pebble is a basic magic projectile skill with a follow-up thrust, making it a solid early-game choice for Intelligence builds. However, it is outclassed by its own sorcery version and especially by the Glintstone Kris's unique skill, 'Glintstone Dart'. The follow-up thrust is also weaker than dedicated thrusting skills.

item.description: Fires a magic pebble projectile, with an optional follow-up lunging thrust. Scales with Intelligence.
pros: A reliable early-game ranged option for Intelligence builds.
The follow-up provides a melee option for close quarters.
cons: Projectile range is short.
Completely outclassed by the Glintstone Dart skill on the Glintstone Kris weapon.
The follow-up thrust is inferior to dedicated thrusting skills like Piercing Fang.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Igon's Drake Hunt (#60, B Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Igon's Drake Hunt is the premier sniping skill for Greatbows, dealing more damage than Through and Through. It excels in exploration and picking off enemies from afar. Its main downsides are its late acquisition in the DLC and a long animation, making it impractical for fast-paced boss fights.

item.description: A powerful sniping skill for Greatbows that fires a piercing shot.
pros: The best sniping skill available for Greatbows.
Excellent for exploration and eliminating enemies from a safe distance.
Can often one-shot standard enemies with a headshot.
cons: Obtained very late in the DLC.
Long animation makes it impractical for intense, close-quarters combat or against fast bosses.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Beast's Roar (#59, B Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Beast's Roar is a Dexterity-scaling projectile with excellent range, making it a powerful tool for safely dealing with enemies. It can be used to 'cheese' many encounters. However, it is largely outclassed by Storm Blade, which offers better stunlock, more stance damage, and a faster, spammable attack with a close-range hitbox.

item.description: A roar that launches a fast, long-range, invisible projectile that scales with Dexterity.
pros: Excellent projectile range.
Can be used to easily defeat enemies from a safe distance.
Can be equipped on almost any weapon type.
cons: Generally outclassed by Storm Blade, which has better stunlock, stance damage, and a faster casting speed.
Lacks the close-range utility of Storm Blade's initial swing.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Sword Dance (#58, B Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Sword Dance is a multi-hit skill that closes distance effectively and can be equipped on a wide variety of weapons, including large ones. While useful for its mobility, it has mediocre stance damage and a slow follow-up, and is often outclassed by spinning skills like Spinning Slash for pure damage and stunlocking.

item.description: A multi-hitting skill where the user dashes forward with a series of slashes.
pros: Effectively closes the distance to an enemy.
Can be equipped on a very wide variety of weapon types, including Halberds and Greataxes.
Looks flashy.
cons: Mediocre stance damage.
The long animation can leave the user vulnerable.
Often outclassed by spinning-type skills (Spinning Slash, Stormcaller) which offer better damage and stunlock.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Waves of Darkness (#57, B Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Waves of Darkness functions like Ground Slam but deals magic damage scaling with Intelligence. It emits three progressive waves of gravity magic, excellent for stunlocking smaller enemies. While it has a large AoE and can apply Frostbite with a Cold infusion, its damage isn't exceptional and it requires a large weapon.

item.description: User slams their weapon down, creating three successive waves of gravitational magic. Scales with Intelligence.
pros: The three successive waves are excellent for stunlocking smaller enemies.
Provides a wide AoE for crowd control.
Can apply Frostbite if the weapon is Cold-infused, as the waves will also proc it.
cons: Damage is not particularly high.
Requires a large weapon type (Greataxes, Warhammers, Colossal Weapons).
Long animation can leave the user vulnerable.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #59 Beast's Roar
knowledge_chunks.summary: Beast's Roar is a Dexterity-based projectile Ash of War that fires a fast, long-range projectile. While effective enough to complete the game with, it is considered outclassed by Storm Blade, which offers better stunlock, stance damage, and spam-ability. Beast's Roar's main advantages are its wider weapon compatibility and its synergy with items like the Roar Medallion and Highland Axe.

pros: Fires a fast, long-range projectile.
Can be equipped on almost every weapon type.
Damage is boosted by the Roar Medallion and Highland Axe.
cons: Considered inferior to Storm Blade in most aspects.
Lacks a close-range hitbox.
Slower to reuse compared to similar skills.
structured_data.comparison: Outclassed by Storm Blade, which deals more stance damage, stunlocks better, and can be used more frequently.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #58 Sword Dance
knowledge_chunks.summary: Sword Dance is a multi-hit lunging Ash of War that can close gaps effectively. It can be equipped on a wide variety of weapons, including Halberds and Greataxes. However, it is held back by a long animation, a slow follow-up attack, and low stance damage, making other skills like Spinning Slash or Stormcaller better for pure damage or posture breaking.

pros: Good for closing the distance to an enemy.
Decent damage output.
Can be applied to a wide range of weapon types.
cons: Long, vulnerable animation.
Slow follow-up attack.
Poor stance damage.
structured_data.comparison: Generally outperformed by skills like Spinning Slash, Stormcaller, or Spinning Strikes for damage and stance pressure.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #57 Waves of Darkness
knowledge_chunks.summary: Waves of Darkness is a large AoE skill for large weapons that creates pulsing waves of gravity magic. It scales with Intelligence and has a long animation similar to Earthshaker. While the periodic waves can stunlock smaller enemies and apply frostbite with a Cold infusion, its overall damage is not very high for the commitment required.

pros: Large AoE with pulsing damage that can stunlock enemies.
Good range on the waves.
Synergizes with Cold infusion to apply frostbite.
cons: Long, punishable animation.
Damage output is relatively low for the commitment.
Restricted to large weapon types.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #56 Savage Lion's Claw
knowledge_chunks.summary: Savage Lion's Claw is a lunging attack with a multi-hit follow-up. It is considered inferior to the regular Lion's Claw, which provides higher stance damage (36) and a knockdown on a single, faster hit. Savage Lion's Claw's initial hit has very low stance damage (15), with the better stance damage (36) and knockdown loaded into the slow, extended follow-up combo, making it less efficient and harder to use effectively.

pros: Lunges slightly further than the regular Lion's Claw.
Follow-up attack is multi-hit, which can benefit status builds.
cons: Significantly less efficient than Lion's Claw for damage and stance breaking.
Initial hit has very low stance damage.
Requires a very long opening to complete the full combo.
structured_data.comparison: Directly inferior to the standard Lion's Claw, which does more stance damage and flattens enemies on a single, faster hit. It's often better to just use Lion's Claw twice.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #55 Carian Retaliation
knowledge_chunks.summary: Carian Retaliation is rated as the best parry skill in the game. When applied to a medium or small shield, it provides the most parry frames, making timing easier. It uniquely costs no FP for melee parries. It can also deflect spells, turning them into glintblade projectiles, though this feature is less impactful. Its primary value is as a highly effective and forgiving tool for standard parrying.

pros: Provides the most parry frames in the game on medium/small shields.
Costs no FP to perform a standard melee parry.
Can parry and reflect magic spells.
cons: Parrying as a mechanic is niche and less effective against many bosses compared to stance breaking.
Reflected spell damage is not very high.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #54 Overhead Stance
knowledge_chunks.summary: Overhead Stance is an Ash of War exclusive to the Great Katana, offering a stance with two different follow-up attacks. While it has good damage, it suffers from very low stance damage (10-20), making it inferior to other options like Repeating Thrust or Blood Tax for both damage and utility. Its viability increases with the DLC talisman Rellana's Cameo, but it remains a niche and generally outclassed skill.

pros: Can output high raw damage.
Synergizes with the Rellana's Cameo talisman from the DLC.
cons: Extremely low stance damage compared to similar skills.
Outclassed by skills like Repeating Thrust and Blood Tax, which offer better damage types, status buildup, and utility.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #53 Flame of the Redmanes
knowledge_chunks.summary: Flame of the Redmanes is a fire-based AoE projectile that scales with Strength. It was heavily nerfed, drastically reducing its once-amazing stance damage. It remains a decent ranged fire option for Strength builds, especially when buffed. However, it's now largely outclassed by Flaming Strike, which provides similar utility with a weapon buff and a more damaging follow-up.

pros: Provides a ranged AoE fire attack for Strength builds.
Damage can be boosted by items like the Fire Scorpion Charm or Freyja's Greatsword (DLC).
cons: Stance damage was heavily nerfed, removing its primary advantage.
Generally outclassed by Flaming Strike, which offers more versatility and damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #52 Dryleaf Whirlwind
knowledge_chunks.summary: Dryleaf Whirlwind is a multi-kick flurry attack exclusive to Hand-to-Hand Arts weapons. It is highly effective at stunlocking and applying status effects to smaller, staggerable enemies like knights. However, its animation slows down drastically against larger, unstaggerable bosses, making it very risky and ineffective in those fights, where standard combos or other skills like Palm Blast are preferable.

pros: Excellent for stunlocking and defeating smaller, human-sized enemies.
Good for applying status effects due to its multi-hit nature.
cons: Very slow and risky to use against large or unstaggerable enemies.
Limited to a single weapon category.
Outperformed by Palm Blast for overall utility on fist weapons.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #51 Repeating Thrust
knowledge_chunks.summary: Repeating Thrust is a multi-hit poking skill excellent for stunlocking smaller enemies and applying status effects due to its speed and low FP cost. It pairs well with weapons that have high base damage and status buildup, like the Sword Lance. However, against larger bosses that cannot be stunlocked, its long animation makes it risky. It is considered outclassed by Blood Tax, which has the same animation but provides significant health regeneration.

pros: Excellent for stunlocking smaller enemies.
Great for applying status effects (e.g., bleed, poison) quickly.
Low FP cost (7 FP).
cons: Long animation makes it vulnerable against larger bosses.
Outclassed by Blood Tax, which provides healing for a similar function.
structured_data.comparison: Blood Tax has an identical animation but also heals the user for ~15% HP per use, making it a superior choice despite Repeating Thrust having slightly more raw damage and lower FP cost.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #50 Rain of Arrows
knowledge_chunks.summary: Rain of Arrows is considered the best general-purpose Ash of War for all bow types. It is highly efficient, firing a volley of roughly 30 arrows for the cost of a single arrow and some FP. This makes it exceptional for applying status effects and dealing high damage to large bosses, where most of the arrows will connect. While Radahn's Rain on the Lion Greatbow can do more damage, Rain of Arrows is more efficient and versatile.

pros: Extremely efficient, firing a large volley for the cost of one arrow.
Excellent for applying status effects.
Deals massive damage to large targets that get hit by the full volley.
cons: Less effective against small, mobile targets.
Requires locking on to a target to aim the volley.
structured_data.comparison: More efficient than Radahn's Rain (Lion Greatbow's skill), making it the superior choice for general bow builds, though Radahn's Rain may have higher burst potential.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #49 Eruption
knowledge_chunks.summary: Eruption is a magma-based AoE Ash of War for large weapons that scales primarily with Strength. It leaves a pool of lava that deals continuous damage. The skill benefits from the Talisman of the Dread (DLC) for a 15% damage boost. However, its long animation, close-range nature, and moderate stance damage (22) make it risky against aggressive bosses, and it is often outclassed by other slow, heavy-hitting skills.

pros: Good source of fire damage for Strength builds.
Creates a damaging lava pool for area denial.
Damage is boosted by the Talisman of the Dread.
cons: Long, close-range animation is very punishable.
Stance damage is only moderate.
Less effective against highly mobile bosses.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #48 Shield Crash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Shield Crash is considered a direct upgrade to Shield Bash. It allows the user to charge forward, blocking attacks, and ends with a powerful crash that can stunlock and knock down enemies like knights. It's an excellent tool for builds using smaller weapons that lack stagger potential. When used with a greatshield and status effects, it can even become a primary source of damage, though it remains a niche playstyle.

pros: Effectively blocks incoming damage while charging.
Excellent at staggering, stunlocking, and knocking down enemies.
Damage scales with shield level and can be a viable primary attack.
cons: Occupies the Ash of War slot, preventing the use of other weapon skills unless two-handing.
Shield-focused builds are a niche playstyle.
structured_data.comparison: A direct upgrade to Shield Bash.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #47 Sacred Order
knowledge_chunks.summary: Sacred Order is a unique weapon buff that provides a 10% damage increase and adds bonus damage against Undead. Its key feature is that it buffs both equipped hands, allowing a player to apply it with an off-hand dagger and still receive the benefit on their main-hand weapon or spell catalyst. This makes it a great utility for skill-based or caster builds to gain an extra layer of damage, especially against skeletons or Death Rite Birds.

pros: Buffs both left and right-hand weapons/catalysts simultaneously.
Provides a 10% universal damage boost.
Deals significant bonus damage to Undead enemies.
Excellent utility for skill or spell-focused builds.
cons: The damage buff is lower than dedicated buffs like Cragblade.
Requires keeping the buffing weapon in the off-hand, preventing two-handing of the main weapon.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #46 Bloody Slash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Bloody Slash is a medium-range bleed projectile Ash of War that scales with Arcane. It is purely a projectile and has no weapon hitbox. It's an effective early-game option for bleed builds, dealing good damage in a single hit. The skill is best suited for smaller weapons and is a strong choice for getting maximum damage from one attack on an Arcane build, though it costs HP to use.

pros: Good damage and bleed buildup.
Solid ranged option for Arcane builds.
One of the earliest accessible bleed skills.
cons: Consumes player HP upon use.
Is a pure projectile, no additional weapon hitbox at close range.
Outclassed later by other options like Bloodflame Blade in terms of efficiency.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #45 Quickstep
knowledge_chunks.summary: Quickstep is a mobility Ash of War that serves as a fast, spammable dodge. It is cheaper and has less recovery than Bloodhound's Step, and its shorter travel distance can be advantageous for positioning for backstabs without overshooting the target. While generally less useful than a dedicated damaging skill, its efficiency and synergy with new DLC items that buff actions after a backstep make it a solid choice for specific agile builds.

pros: Cheaper, faster, and more spammable than Bloodhound's Step.
Shorter distance makes positioning for backstabs easier.
Low recovery frames.
Synergizes with DLC items that buff attacks after backstepping.
cons: Occupies an Ash of War slot that could be used for a damaging skill.
The standard dodge roll is sufficient for most situations.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #44 Seppuku
knowledge_chunks.summary: Seppuku is a powerful weapon buff for bleed builds that significantly increases bleed buildup and scales with the Arcane stat. Its best use is with an Occult infusion on a weapon that already has passive bleed, like the Scavenger's Curved Sword. A key feature is that using the skill procs the player's own bleed status, activating talismans like Lord of Blood's Exultation and the White Mask for a massive damage boost.

pros: Provides a massive boost to bleed buildup.
Self-procs bleed to activate damage buffs from Lord of Blood's Exultation and White Mask.
Extremely effective on Occult-infused weapons with innate bleed.
cons: Less effective with a standard Bleed infusion due to poor Arcane scaling.
Requires a specific setup to be fully optimized.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #43 Chilling Mist
knowledge_chunks.summary: Chilling Mist is primarily a utility Ash of War, used to apply the Frostbite status effect rather than for direct damage. The ideal strategy is to apply it to an off-hand dagger, use the skill to create a frost cloud and buff the dagger, and then attack with a main-hand weapon. This applies the Frostbite debuff, which lowers enemy defense by 20% for 30 seconds, making it a powerful tool for any non-Intelligence build (Strength, Faith, Arcane) to increase their overall damage.

pros: Applies the powerful Frostbite debuff, reducing enemy defense by 20%.
Excellent utility skill for any build lacking innate access to frost.
Can be used on an off-hand weapon to support a main-hand setup.
cons: Not intended as a primary damage source.
The Frostbite debuff is reset by fire damage, creating anti-synergy with fire builds.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #42 Carian Grandeur
knowledge_chunks.summary: Carian Grandeur is a magic-based Ash of War where the user summons a large magic greatsword and slams it down. It can be charged up to three times, delivering monstrous damage and very high stance damage (45) when fully charged. It is an extremely powerful skill capable of destroying bosses if a sufficient opening is available. While excellent in the base game, it is eventually outclassed by the similar but superior DLC skill, Carian Sovereignty.

pros: Deals massive damage when fully charged.
Excellent stance damage (45), capable of breaking boss postures.
Good range.
cons: Long charge time requires a large opening.
Superseded by a better version, Carian Sovereignty, in the DLC.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: #41 Double Slash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Double Slash is a versatile multi-hit Ash of War that outputs good damage and excels at applying status effects. It has two variants: a slower one for larger weapons like greatswords and a faster one for smaller weapons like katanas and curved swords. The faster variant is generally preferred for its quick animations and superior ability to build up status effects like bleed or frost.

pros: Good damage output.
Excellent for applying status effects due to multiple quick hits.
Available in two versions for different weapon classes.
cons: Can be animation-locked, leaving the user vulnerable.
The version for larger weapons is significantly slower.
structured_data.recommendation: Particularly effective on smaller, faster weapons like Katanas and Curved Swords for status effect builds.
