knowledge_chunks.topic: #41 - Ash of War: Double Slash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Double Slash is a fast, multi-hit Ash of War that excels at applying status effects like bleed or frost, particularly on faster weapons such as Katanas or Curved Swords. While its animation speed is a major benefit for status builds, it is generally outclassed for raw damage or stance breaking by other skills like Unsheathe for Katanas or Spinning Slash for Curved Swords. Its utility is considered niche and primarily focused on status application.

data.primary_use: Rapidly applying status effects (e.g., Bleed, Frost).
pros: Fast animation speed allows for quick hits.
Excellent for building up status effects due to its multi-hit nature.
cons: Lower damage and stance break potential compared to other skills.
Niche use case, mainly for status-focused builds.

comparisons.comment: A better option for Katanas if not focusing purely on status effects.
A better option for Curved Swords that also provides stance pressure.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #40 - Ash of War: Assassin's Gambit
knowledge_chunks.summary: Assassin's Gambit is described as the best stealth-based tool in the game. It grants the user semi-invisibility and silences their footsteps, allowing them to traverse dangerous areas and even run past enemies without being detected. It is highly recommended to have this Ash of War on a lightweight weapon in the inventory for utility purposes, like escaping a bad situation or navigating legacy dungeons.

data.effect: Grants temporary semi-invisibility and silences footsteps.
data.usage_strategy: Use to run through entire areas or legacy dungeons undetected. Excellent for challenge runs or when low on health to avoid combat.
data.recommendation: Equip on a separate, lightweight weapon to swap to when stealth is needed.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #39 - Ash of War: Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker
knowledge_chunks.summary: Hoarah Loux's Earthshaker is presented as the best Strength-based AoE Ash of War, delivering amazing damage and exceptionally high stance damage (55 stated). It offers great hyper armor and can be applied to almost any weapon, though its damage scales exclusively with Strength. Its main weakness is a long, punishable animation, making it best used during significant enemy openings.

pros: Excellent damage and stance damage.
High hyper armor during animation.
Initial roar can stunlock enemies.
Great for crowd control.
cons: Very long animation, leaving the user vulnerable.
Damage scales only with Strength, making it less optimal for non-Strength builds.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #38 - Weapon Skill: Aspects of the Crucible
knowledge_chunks.summary: This section covers the Aspects of the Crucible skills. The 'Wings' variant (from Siluria's Tree) is a slow, chargeable lunge that is outclassed in stance damage by faster alternatives like Piercing Fang. The 'Horns' variant (from the Crucible Tree Armor) is a flurry attack on Twinblades effective for applying status like Bloodflame Blade on large enemies, but can miss smaller ones. The 'Tail' variant (from Ordovis's Greatsword) is also mentioned.

variants.name: Aspects of the Crucible: Wings
variants.source: Siluria's Tree (Spear), can be put on Colossal Swords.
variants.description: A long-range, chargeable lunge attack. Slower but higher damage than similar skills. Stance damage is ~20.
variants.comparison: Slower and less stance damage than Piercing Fang or Impaling Thrust.

variants.name: Aspects of the Crucible: Horns
variants.source: Crucible Tree Armor skill, also on Twinblades.
variants.description: A flurry attack. Good against large enemies for status buildup (e.g., with Bloodflame Blade), but can overshoot and miss smaller targets.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #37 - Ash of War: Shriek of Sorrow
knowledge_chunks.summary: Shriek of Sorrow is a unique DLC weapon buff that increases damage based on how low your health is, starting at a 10% boost and scaling up to 30% when below 25% HP. Its buff can be 'snapshotted' by activating it at low health and then healing. This skill is particularly valuable for unique DLC weapons (like Smithscript weapons) that cannot be buffed by other means.

data.effect: Applies a weapon buff that increases damage the lower your HP is.
pros: Potentially the highest damage weapon buff in the game.
Fast activation.
Can be used to buff unique weapons that other skills cannot.
Buff persists even if you heal after casting.
cons: Situational; requires risky low-health play for maximum benefit.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #36 - Ash of War: Sacred Blade
knowledge_chunks.summary: Sacred Blade fires a fast Holy projectile and buffs the weapon with 80 flat Holy damage for 40 seconds, making it a staple for Faith builds. It's easy to use, FP-efficient, and obtainable early in the game. While Holy damage struggles against some late-game base game bosses, it is more effective against enemies in the DLC.

data.effect: Fires a Holy projectile and adds +80 flat Holy damage to the weapon.
pros: Provides a ranged attack and a weapon buff in one skill.
Fast, easy to use, and low FP cost.
Obtainable early.
More useful in the DLC due to enemy weaknesses.
cons: Holy damage is heavily resisted by several final bosses in the base game.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #35 - Weapon Skill: Spinning Gravity Thrust
knowledge_chunks.summary: This is a unique skill on the DLC weapon Dragonmaw. It's a high-damage attack with a long animation, combining a spin with a piercing thrust. It can be put on a colossal sword and deals monstrous damage, but its long recovery frames make it risky. The skill's potential is maximized when paired with effects like Malenia's Great Rune, which allows the user to regain health while trading hits.

pros: Monstrous damage output.
Good status and stance damage buildup.
Can send enemies flying.
cons: Very long animation with slow recovery, leaving the user vulnerable.
High FP cost.
data.synergy: Pairs extremely well with Malenia's Great Rune to negate damage taken by trading hits.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #34 - Weapon Skill: Swift Slash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Swift Slash is a unique skill on the DLC weapon, the Backhand Blade. It is a fast gap-closing attack that, when charged, hits multiple times, making it good for status procs. The skill has been nerfed and reportedly has a bug where the aftershock from the charged attack misses large bosses, reducing its effectiveness. It still offers good mix-up potential as it can be redirected.

pros: Fast gap-closing attack.
Charged version hits multiple times, good for status buildup.
Offers mix-up potential through redirection.
cons: Has been nerfed from its previous power level.
The fully charged version's aftershock is bugged and can miss large bosses.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #33 - Ash of War: Vacuum Slice
knowledge_chunks.summary: Vacuum Slice provides a much-needed ranged projectile option for Colossal Swords. It deals more damage and stance damage per hit than Storm Blade, especially at close range where the blade also connects. However, it is slower, more FP-costly, and has an inconsistent projectile hitbox on uneven terrain, making Storm Blade a more reliable, if weaker, alternative in many situations.

pros: Good projectile option for large weapons.
Higher damage and stance damage than Storm Blade in a single hit.
cons: Slower and more FP-costly than Storm Blade.
Projectile can disappear on uneven ground.
Does not track upwards.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #32 - Ash of War: Endure
knowledge_chunks.summary: Endure is a highly underrated defensive Ash of War that grants immense poise and 45% damage negation for 3 seconds. Its fast, low-cost activation makes it perfect for face-tanking hits and creating openings for attacks or spells. It's most effective when used with smaller, faster weapons like fists or curved swords, as larger weapons often have their own hyper armor.

data.effect: Temporarily boosts poise and damage negation.
data.buff_details: Grants massive poise and 45% damage negation to all damage types.
pros: Allows for safe damage trading.
Prevents interruptions when casting spells or attacking.
Very fast animation and low FP cost.
cons: Very short duration requires precise timing.
Less beneficial for large weapons that already have hyper armor.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #31 - Ash of War: Spectral Lance
knowledge_chunks.summary: Spectral Lance is a projectile skill for polearms that scales with the Arcane stat. It is highly valued for its exceptional stance damage (25-27.5), long range, and head-seeking tracking, which can lead to bonus damage. Despite its somewhat low base damage, its ability to reliably break enemy stance from a safe distance makes it a top-tier option for Arcane builds.

pros: Exceptional stance damage from range.
Projectile tracks enemy heads for potential bonus damage.
Very long range, extendable with Arrow's Reach Talisman.
Very low FP cost (9 FP).
cons: Base damage is relatively low.
Limited to Arcane builds for effective scaling.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #30 - Ash of War: Phantom Slash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Phantom Slash summons a phantom that attacks alongside the player, offering a follow-up strike for a full combo. It is highly FP-efficient and has a high skill ceiling for creative plays, such as hitting multiple targets or dodging while the phantom engages. Its main weaknesses are low hyper armor and mediocre stance damage.

pros: Good damage potential in a full combo.
FP efficient.
High skill ceiling for mix-ups and hitting multiple enemies.
Phantom attack completes even if the player is interrupted.
cons: Low hyper armor.
Mediocre stance damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #29 - Ash of War: Divine Beast Frost Stomp
knowledge_chunks.summary: This DLC Ash of War is an upgraded version of Hoarfrost Stomp, creating a powerful cold AoE that scales with Dexterity and Intelligence. It's excellent for Dexterity builds, offering great frost buildup, a chargeable attack, and compatibility with any weapon type. The damage is further enhanced by talismans that boost stomping skills.

pros: Easy to use with a large AoE.
Good frost buildup.
Can be charged for more damage.
Compatible with all weapon types.
cons: Intelligence builds may have better sorcery options.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #28 - Ash of War: Spinning Slash
knowledge_chunks.summary: Spinning Slash has three variants for different weapon sizes, with the version for smaller, faster weapons (swords, axes) being the most effective. It excels at applying status effects and proccing multi-hit talismans due to its rapid, repeated hits. While not the best for pure stance breaking, its ability to stunlock enemies and build status makes it a strong, versatile choice.

data.variants: Three versions exist for small, large, and polearm weapons.
data.best_variant: The version for smaller/quicker weapons is considered the best.
pros: Hits multiple times in quick succession.
Excellent for applying status effects and using multi-hit talismans.
Good for stunlocking enemies.
cons: Outclassed in pure stance damage by skills like Unsheathe or Square Off.
data.usage_strategy: A great skill for weapons like Axes that have less effective power-stancing movesets, turning them into status-applying machines.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #27 - Ash of War: Stormcaller
knowledge_chunks.summary: Stormcaller is a spinning AoE attack that is exceptional at stunlocking staggerable enemies, such as knights and even Malenia, effectively trivializing certain fights. It deals good damage and rapidly applies status effects, with its power boosted by the Enraged Divine Beast Talisman. Its main weakness is its long, uninterruptible animation, which makes it highly situational and risky against large bosses that cannot be staggered.

pros: Incredible stunlock capability against staggerable enemies.
Good damage and rapid status application.
Benefits from poise and hyper armor during the animation.
cons: Highly situational; ineffective and risky against enemies that cannot be staggered.
Long animation locks the player in place.
data.synergy: Boosted by the Enraged Divine Beast Talisman.

knowledge_chunks.topic: #26 - Ash of War: Black Flame Tornado
knowledge_chunks.summary: Black Flame Tornado is a Faith-scaling AoE skill known as a 'boss melting machine' in the base game. Its power comes from the Black Flame effect, which deals damage based on a percentage of the enemy's maximum health, making it devastating against high-HP bosses. While it requires a long opening to use safely, its damage output is immense. However, its effectiveness is significantly nerfed in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.

data.effect: Creates a tornado of Black Flame that deals damage over time based on the target's max HP.
pros: Extremely high damage against high-HP bosses due to percentage-based damage.
Effective even with minimal Faith investment.
cons: Very long, punishable animation.
The percentage-based damage effect is significantly nerfed in the DLC.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Blind Spot (#25, A Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Blind Spot is a skill from the Backhand Blade that provides an i-frame dodge directly into a quick poking attack. It excels at creating opportunities for counter-hits and completely bypasses enemy shields. However, its raw damage is not particularly high, it's ineffective against large bosses, and it consumes significant stamina.

mechanics: Performs a dodge with invincibility frames (i-frames).
Follows up the dodge with a quick poking attack.
Completely bypasses enemy shields.
pros: Excellent for landing counter-hits for bonus damage.
Effective for cheesing smaller, humanoid enemies like knights.
Relatively cheap FP cost and easy to use.
cons: Damage output is not exceptional.
Practically useless against very large bosses.
Consumes a large amount of stamina, limiting consecutive uses to about three.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: The Poison Flower Blooms Twice (#24, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: This S-Tier Ash of War is a direct upgrade to Poison Moth Flight and is found on the 'Poison Flower' weapon. Its primary function is to detonate a poison or rot status effect on an enemy for a burst of damage. It uniquely possesses the ability to apply Scarlet Rot, features a long lunge with fast recovery, deals piercing damage, and can be infused on many weapon types.

mechanics: Removes poison/rot from a target to deal a burst of damage (5% of max HP for poison).
The only Ash of War that applies Scarlet Rot (approx. 140 buildup per hit).
Features a long-range lunging attack with very quick recovery frames.
Deals piercing damage, which is effective against armored enemies.
pros: Unique ability to apply Scarlet Rot via an Ash of War.
Excellent mobility with its long lunge and fast recovery.
Versatile, as it can be infused onto almost any weapon type.
Provides access to piercing damage.
cons: The burst damage from detonating poison is generally weaker than bleed procs.
It consumes the Scarlet Rot effect upon detonation, which can be a negative as Rot is a powerful damage-over-time effect.
synergies: Best used with a high Arcane build.
Optimal pairing is with a weapon that applies poison quickly, such as the Occult-infused Venomous Fang, to set up the detonation.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Flaming Strike (#23, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Flaming Strike is a two-part fire skill that initiates with a flame projectile and follows with a powerful sweeping attack. This follow-up deals high stance damage and buffs the user's weapon with fire damage for a generous 40 seconds, making it an extremely effective and versatile S-Tier Ash of War.

mechanics: Initial cast releases a short-range flame projectile that can stun-lock small enemies.
Follow-up attack is a wide, lunging, fiery swipe.
Buffs the weapon with fire damage for 40 seconds after use.
Projectile damage scales with Strength; follow-up swipe damage scales with total Attack Rating (AR).
pros: Follow-up deals high damage and significant stance damage.
Provides a long-duration weapon buff.
Excellent for staggering enemies and creating openings.
Good for dealing chip damage.
cons: Considered slightly outclassed by Flame Spear in the DLC, but remains one of the best in the base game.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Piercing Fang (#22, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Piercing Fang is an excellent lunging thrust attack known for its impressive range, speed, and ability to deal high stance damage. It is highly versatile and can be equipped on a variety of weapons, including great spears and thrusting swords. Its fantastic tracking allows it to hit evasive enemies, though it is slightly outclassed by Impaling Thrust in some aspects.

mechanics: Performs a long-range, lunging thrust.
Deals high stance damage.
Features excellent tracking, allowing for 180-degree turns to catch enemies.
pros: Exceptional range and speed.
Very easy and intuitive to use.
Can be equipped on many weapon types (Thrusting Swords, Heavy Thrusting Swords, Great Spears).
cons: Slightly inferior to Impaling Thrust, which is noted as being faster, cheaper, and dealing the same stance damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Braggart's Roar (#21, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Braggart's Roar is the best of the 'Roar' type weapon buffs, offering a comprehensive boost of 10% to damage, defense, and stamina recovery. It also alters heavy attacks into a powerful new combo, which is especially devastating when used with polearms. Its multiple benefits make it a top-tier choice for Strength builds.

mechanics: Provides a buff with three effects: +10% physical damage, +10% damage negation, and +10% stamina recovery speed.
Changes the moveset of heavy attacks while active.
pros: Offers the best combination of buffs among all roar skills.
The modified heavy attack, especially on polearms, is extremely effective.
Can be used in power stance builds for stacking effects.
cons: The modified heavy attack animations can be longer than standard ones, which may reduce stance break speed in some situations.
synergies: Pairs exceptionally well with Polearms (Great Spears, Halberds).
Stacks with the Roar Medallion, the passive buff from the Highland Axe, and the Axe Talisman for the heavy attacks.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Barricade Shield (#20, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Barricade Shield is the best shield-based Ash of War, temporarily increasing a shield's guard boost to trivialize many enemy attacks. It significantly reduces stamina consumption when blocking, allowing even medium shields to function like greatshields. It is cheap, fast, and lasts for 10 seconds, making it an incredible defensive tool.

mechanics: Temporarily buffs the equipped shield, massively increasing its Guard Boost.
This causes attacks to bounce off more easily (increasing shield hardness) and consume far less stamina to block.
The effect lasts for 10 seconds.
pros: Makes blocking incredibly effective, trivializing many enemies.
Allows medium shields to perform like greatshields.
Very cheap FP cost and a fast activation animation.
Recent patches have buffed medium shields, making this skill even more effective.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Spinning Strikes (#19, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Spinning Strikes is a continuous spinning attack ideal for high DPS, especially against large, non-staggerable bosses. It is best used on polearms and pairs exceptionally well with status effect builds (like bleed) due to its rapid, multi-hit nature. While it lacks hyper armor, its ability to be cancelled after any swing and its follow-up attacks provide good versatility and stance damage potential.

mechanics: Performs a continuous spinning attack.
Can be cancelled after any individual swing.
Has a follow-up light or heavy attack that can deal good stance damage.
pros: High damage-per-second (DPS).
Excellent for applying status effects (bleed, frost, poison) quickly.
Cancellable nature provides flexibility.
Follow-up attack is great for stance breaking.
cons: Lacks hyper armor, making the user vulnerable to being interrupted.
synergies: Pairs extremely well with status effect builds, such as a Bloodflame Blade-buffed Grave Scythe.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Palm Blast (#18, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Palm Blast is the premier Ash of War for Hand-to-Hand arts (fist weapons), filling a crucial gap in their moveset. It provides a powerful, chargeable blast with immense hyper armor and stance damage, allowing users to trade blows effectively. It can knock down smaller enemies and has a surprising area-of-effect range, complementing the fast, close-range nature of fist weapons.

mechanics: A chargeable explosive palm strike.
Grants massive hyper armor, making it almost impossible to be staggered out of the animation.
Deals very high stance damage.
Knocks smaller enemies to the ground.
The AOE extends to a medium range.
pros: Fills a needed niche for fist weapons by providing hyper armor and high stance damage.
Allows for extremely favorable damage trades.
Excellent for crowd control against smaller enemies.
Great for stance-breaking bosses.
cons: The uncharged version is practically useless.
Requires committing to a long animation, making timing important.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Prayerful Strike (#17, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Prayerful Strike is a highly underrated Ash of War that delivers a powerful downward slam, granting immense hyper armor and healing the user for 30% of their maximum health upon hitting an enemy. This allows for incredibly favorable trades, making it a top-tier survival and damage tool, especially on large, heavy-hitting weapons.

mechanics: Performs a heavy downward slam with a weapon.
Grants a very large amount of hyper armor during the animation.
Heals the user for 30% of their maximum HP upon successfully hitting an enemy.
Deals high stance damage (over 35 with larger weapons).
pros: Massive self-heal enables extremely effective damage trading.
Incredible hyper armor prevents interruption.
High stance damage for breaking enemy posture.
Can be used as a primary damage and survival tool.
cons: Limited to Sacred or Heavy infusions, though this is rarely a major drawback for builds that would use it.
synergies: Excellent on large weapons like Hammers and Colossal Weapons.
Can be used as an off-hand option for a quick heal in power stance builds.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Royal Knight's Resolve (#16, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Royal Knight's Resolve is one of the best weapon buffs, providing a massive 80% damage increase to the next weapon hit. While the buff is consumed after one hit, it's perfect for builds focusing on single, powerful attacks like charged heavy attacks or guard counters. Though somewhat outclassed by Cragblade for stance-breaking builds, its sheer damage potential keeps it firmly in S-Tier.

mechanics: Buffs the weapon to grant an 80% damage bonus to the next successful attack.
The buff is consumed after one hit connects.
Boosts all types of damage, not just physical.
pros: Provides a massive 80% damage boost, one of the highest in the game.
Boosts all damage types, making it versatile for various infusions.
Excellent for builds centered around a single, powerful hit.
cons: Buff only lasts for a single hit.
Considered less efficient for general use than Cragblade, which lasts 60 seconds and also boosts stance damage.
synergies: Ideal for charged heavy attack builds, guard counter builds, and jumping attack builds, especially with large weapons.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Wild Strikes (#15, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Wild Strikes is a top-tier Ash of War for heavy-hitting weapons like Greataxes and Great Hammers. It unleashes a continuous series of powerful swings with high hyper armor, allowing for effective damage trading. The skill is FP-efficient, pairs well with status effects, and has versatile light and heavy follow-up attacks, making it a formidable choice for aggressive melee builds.

structured_data.weapon_type_restriction: Axes and Hammers (including Great and Colossal variants)
mechanics: Performs a continuous combo of wild, heavy swings.
Grants a large amount of hyper armor during the animation.
Consumes only 2 FP per swing.
Has a powerful follow-up attack available with a light or heavy input.
pros: High, continuous damage output.
Excellent hyper armor for trading blows.
Very FP-efficient for sustained use.
Follow-up attacks provide high damage and stance damage.
Effective at applying status effects.
cons: Requires a significant opening to use effectively against faster bosses.
synergies: Pairs extremely well with the Rusted Anchor for piercing counter-attack damage.
Excellent with status effect builds (bleed, frost).

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Flame Spear (#14, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Flame Spear is presented as a slightly upgraded version of Flaming Strike, offering a powerful poking attack that can be fully charged for extra damage and range. Like its counterpart, it also buffs the weapon with fire damage. Its key advantage is its applicability to a wider range of weapons, including Colossal Swords, making it a top-tier choice for Faith/Strength builds.

mechanics: Part 1 is a flame breath that buffs the weapon with +95 fire damage for 40 seconds.
Part 2 is a chargeable, long-range, fiery spear thrust.
The buffing animation is faster than Flaming Strike's.
pros: Provides a slightly stronger weapon buff than Flaming Strike (+95 fire vs +85).
The attack can be charged for more damage.
Incredible range on the thrust attack.
Can be equipped on a very wide variety of weapons, including Colossal Swords.
synergies: Excellent for Faith-based builds using the Flame Art infusion.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Carian Sovereignty (#13, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Carian Sovereignty is the ultimate version of the Carian greatsword skills, offering a multi-charge magic sword slash with a powerful follow-up. The entire combo can deal an immense 93 stance damage, making it one of the best stance-breaking tools in the game. Despite its long animation and lack of hyper armor, its sheer power and ability to be paired with the Stonebarb Cracked Tear makes it exceptional.

mechanics: A chargeable magic greatsword slash that can be charged twice.
Includes a fast, fully-charged follow-up attack.
The full combo deals a massive 93 stance damage.
Deals pure magic damage.
pros: Exceptional stance damage, capable of breaking posture on most bosses with one combo.
High damage output.
Follow-up attack comes out surprisingly fast.
cons: Very long animation to perform the full combo.
Lacks hyper armor, making it easy to interrupt.
Less effective on enemies that are highly mobile or aggressive.
synergies: Pairs well with the Stonebarb Cracked Tear to reach over 120 stance damage in one combo.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Giant Hunt (#12, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Giant Hunt is an upward-thrusting poking attack that excels at launching enemies into the air and dealing high damage. While it competes with other poking skills, its unique advantage is its compatibility with Colossal Swords. This pairing creates a devastating build that can outperform even the legendary Lion's Claw in terms of damage and utility, making it a top-tier skill with a high skill ceiling.

mechanics: Performs a powerful upward thrusting attack.
Launches smaller and man-sized enemies into the air.
Deals high damage and stance damage.
pros: Can be infused onto Colossal Swords, which other top-tier poking skills cannot.
Can deal more damage than Lion's Claw.
Deals thrusting damage, which is often a superior damage type.
Faster animation than Lion's Claw.
cons: As a poking skill, it's outclassed on smaller weapons by Impaling Thrust or Piercing Fang.
Lower hyper armor than Lion's Claw.
synergies: Extremely powerful when used with a Colossal Sword build.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Blood Tax (#11, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Blood Tax is a multi-hit thrusting attack that is functionally identical to Repeating Thrust but with the added benefit of healing the user on hit. This life-steal, combined with its excellent ability to apply status effects and stunlock enemies, makes it a superior and incredibly powerful S-Tier option. Its damage can be further boosted by Ansbach's Set and the Bloodsucking Cracked Tear, nearly matching the damage of its non-healing counterpart.

mechanics: Performs a four-hit thrusting combo.
Heals the user for a portion of health with each hit that connects.
Can stunlock smaller enemies.
pros: Provides significant health regeneration (can heal almost 20% of max HP with the full combo).
Excellent at applying status effects (bleed, poison, frost) due to its multi-hit nature.
Great for stunlocking enemies.
Can be used on versatile weapons like the Great Katana or Swordlance.
cons: Deals slightly less raw damage than Repeating Thrust, its non-healing equivalent.
synergies: Damage is boosted by wearing Ansbach's Set (+14%).
Synergizes well with the Bloodsucking Cracked Tear in the physick flask for another +20% damage.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Impaling Thrust (#10, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Impaling Thrust is the best all-around poking skill in Elden Ring. It is incredibly fast, has a very low FP cost, and deals amazing stance damage (33), equivalent to the much slower Piercing Fang. Its efficiency, speed, and power make it a top-tier choice for a vast number of weapon types, allowing it to cheese many enemies with ease.

mechanics: Performs a fast, lunging thrust.
Deals high stance damage (~33), equal to slower poking skills.
Bypasses shields.
pros: Extremely fast animation.
Very cheap FP cost.
Exceptional stance damage for its speed and cost.
Can be equipped on a wide variety of weapons (Greatswords, Great Spears, Thrusting Swords, etc.).

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Analysis: Blood Blade (#9, S Tier)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Blood Blade is the best of the 'blade' projectile skills, firing a blood projectile that scales with the Arcane stat. It's a superior version of skills like Reduvia's Blood Blade because it can be applied to larger weapons like Katanas and Curved Swords for higher damage. The projectile also has a close-range hitbox, allowing it to hit twice for massive bleed buildup and damage.

mechanics: Fires a projectile made of blood that scales with the Arcane stat.
The skill has a secondary hitbox on the weapon itself at close range, allowing it to hit twice.
Deals high blood loss buildup.
pros: High damage and bleed buildup, especially at close range.
Can be applied to larger weapons (Katanas, Curved Swords) for better damage scaling than unique weapon versions.
Spammable and effective for ranged and close-quarters combat.
cons: Consumes a small amount of the user's HP on each cast.
synergies: Ideal for Arcane builds.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Blood Blade (#9)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Blood Blade is an Arcane-based projectile Ash of War, considered a superior version of the Reduvia dagger's skill. It excels in applying bleed buildup and can be paired with larger weapons like katanas. The initial cast sacrifices a small amount of HP, but it is highly FP and stamina efficient for repeated use.

pros: High damage and bleed buildup
Can be paired with larger weapons for better reach and damage
Has a close-range hitbox in addition to the projectile
Low FP and stamina cost, especially compared to Reduvia's skill
Subsequent casts do not consume health
cons: Initial cast consumes a small amount of player HP
Ineffective against enemies immune to bleed

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Square Off (#8) & Unsheathe (#7)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Square Off (for Straight Swords) and Unsheathe (for Katanas) are top-tier stance-based skills that provide incredible stance damage for a low cost. Square Off's heavy attack deals 40 stance damage, while Unsheathe's deals 30 with a faster, spammable execution. They effectively eliminate the low stance damage weakness of their respective weapon classes.

structured_data.pros: Extremely high stance damage, cheap FP cost, fast, heavy attack deals piercing damage.
structured_data.pros_2: Very fast execution, high stance damage, recovery can be roll/crouch-cancelled for spamming.
structured_data.comparison_note: Both skills are exceptional for breaking enemy poise with small weapons. Unsheathe is slightly preferred due to Katanas having better range and access to bleed.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Ice Spear (#6)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Ice Spear is a premier magic projectile Ash of War that deals Cold damage and applies Frostbite. It scales with both Dexterity and Intelligence, making it an excellent choice for Dexterity builds needing a ranged magic option. The skill is cheap, fast, and deals high damage and stance damage.

pros: High damage and stance damage
Applies Frostbite status very quickly
Cheap FP cost and fast cast speed
Adds a powerful ranged magic option to Dexterity builds

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Golden Vow (#5)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Golden Vow is one of the most useful Ashes of War, providing a universal damage and defense buff. It affects the caster and nearby allies for 45 seconds, stacks with other buffs, and is ideal for non-Faith builds. To use it, simply apply it to a light off-hand weapon like a dagger and cast it before encounters.

pros: Universal utility for nearly all builds (Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, Arcane)
Buffs nearby allies
Stacks with body and weapon buffs
Easy to apply via a secondary weapon
structured_data.comparison_note: The Golden Vow incantation is a direct upgrade (+15% damage, +10% defense, 80 seconds) but requires 25 Faith.

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Storm Blade (#4)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Storm Blade is a quality-scaling projectile Ash of War that is cheap, spammable, and effective at staggering enemies. It has a dual hitbox, dealing damage both at range and up close, making it highly versatile. Its damage is further enhanced by the 'Enraged Divine Beast' talisman and 'Divine Beast Head' helm from the DLC.

pros: Cheap FP cost for consecutive casts (6-7 FP)
Good stagger and stance damage
Dual hitbox makes it effective at all ranges
Highly versatile for any build with physical stats
synergies: Enraged Divine Beast Talisman (+10% damage)
Divine Beast Head (+5% damage)

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Wing Stance (#3)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Wing Stance, for Light Greatswords, is the best stance-based Ash of War. It combines a spammable flurry attack for stunlocking (15 stance damage) with a powerful lunging poke (30 stance damage). The moves can be comboed, and with Rellana's Cameo, the damage buff persists through the flurry attack, making it exceptionally powerful.

pros: Two highly effective follow-up attacks
Flurry attack can stunlock many enemies
Poke attack deals massive stance damage
Follow-ups can be comboed into each other
Extremely low FP and stamina cost
synergies: Rellana's Cameo (buff is not consumed by the flurry attack, allowing for sustained high damage)

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Cragblade (#2)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Cragblade is the best weapon buff for physical damage builds. It grants a 15% physical damage bonus and a 10% stance damage bonus for 60 seconds. This makes it a core component for any build focused on charged attacks, jump attacks, or guard counters, turning already strong strategies into devastating ones.

pros: Significant boost to both physical and stance damage
Long duration
Enhances the most effective melee playstyles (charged/jumping attacks)
cons: Only buffs physical damage, not suitable for elemental builds
synergies: Two-Handed Sword Talisman
Deflecting Hardtear
Blade of Mercy

knowledge_chunks.topic: Ash of War Guide: Lion's Claw (#1)
knowledge_chunks.summary: Lion's Claw is ranked as the top Ash of War due to its sheer, easy-to-use power. It's a front-flipping slam with immense hyper armor, making it nearly impossible to interrupt. The skill deals incredible stance damage, flattens most enemies for repeated use, and can be applied to a wide variety of weapons, trivializing many encounters.

pros: Massive, nearly infinite hyper armor during the animation
Extremely high stance damage
Flattens smaller enemies, allowing for easy follow-ups and stunlocks
Simple to execute and requires little skill
Can be used on almost any weapon
structured_data.usage_scene: An extremely reliable and powerful offensive tool for safely trading damage and breaking enemy poise.
